ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often do you know what your child does during his/her free time?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know who your child has as friends during his/her free time?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know what type of homework your child has?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know what your child spends his/her money on?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know when your child has an exam or paper due at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know how your child is doing in different subjects at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know where your child goes when s/he is out with friends at night?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you know where your child goes and what your child does after school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: In the last month, how often have you had no idea where your child was at night?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: In the last month, how often have you talked with the parents of your child's friends?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you talk with your child's friends when they come to your home (ask what they do or what they think and feel about different things)?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: During the past month, how often have you started a conversation about your child's free time?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you initiate a conversation about things that happened during a normal day at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you ask your child to talk about things that happened during his/her free time (Whom your child met when s/he was out in the city, free time activities, etc.)?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child need to have your permission to stay out late on a weekday evening?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child need to ask you before s/he can decide with his/her friends what s/he will do on a Saturday evening?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: If your child has been out very late one night, how often do you require that your child explain what s/he did and whom s/he was with?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often do you require that your child tell you where s/he was at night, who s/he was with, and what they did together?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: Before your child goes out on a Saturday night, how often do you require that s/he tells you where s/he is going and with whom?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child talk at home about how s/he is doing in different subjects at school?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child tell how school was when s/he gets home (how s/he did on different exams, his/her relationships with teachers, etc.)?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child keep secrets from you about what s/he does during his/her free time?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: How often does your child hide from you about what s/he does during nights and weekends?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: If your child is out at night, when s/he gets home, how often does s/he tell you what s/he has done that evening?
Notes: 1= No, never (0%); 2= Some of the time (25%); 3= About half the time (50%); 4= More than half, but not always (75%); 5= Yes, always (100%)

ElementDescription: Has it ever happened in the last month that you have had no idea about where the child was in the evening?
Notes: 1= Has never happened; 2= One single time; 3= A few times; 4= Many times; 5= In general; always

ElementDescription: Do you know where your child goes and what he/she does in the afternoon straight after school?
Notes: 1= Yes, completely; 2= Yes, rather well; 3= Yes, pretty good; 4= No, very little; 5= No, not at all

ElementDescription: Has it happened this month that you have had contact and spoken with the parent's of your child's friends?
Notes: 1= Several times a week; 2= At least once a week; 3= A few times this month; 4= At one time this month; 5= No

ElementDescription: How often do you talk with the child's friends when they come to your house? (Ask what they are doing, what they think and feel about different things.)
Notes: 1= Almost always; 2= Often; 3= From time to time; 4= Seldom; 5= Almost never

ElementDescription: In the last month, how often have you had a conversation on your own with the child about how he/she is doing in their free time?
Notes: 1= Several times a week; 2= At least once a week; 3= A few times this month; 4= At one time this month; 5= Not this month

ElementDescription: How often do you ask your child to sit down and tell you about things that have happened at school on an ordinary day?
Notes: 1= Very often; 2= Rather often; 3= From time to time; 4= Seldom; 5= Almost never

ElementDescription: Do you usually ask your child about things that happen in their free time? (Who he/she sees when out, leisure activities.)?
Notes: 1= Very often; 2= Rather often; 3= From time to time; 4= Seldom; 5= Almost never

ElementDescription: Does the child usually want to tell you about how things are going at school? (How he/she does in the different subjects, relationships with teachers and so on.)
Notes: 1= Very often; 2= Rather often; 3= From time to time; 4= Seldom; 5= Almost never

ElementDescription: Does the child keep a lot of things secret about things that happen in their free time?
Notes: 1= Very much; 2= Pretty much; 3= Some; 4= Only a little; 5= Not at all

ElementDescription: Do you think that your child hides much about what he/she does in the evenings and nights?
Notes: 1= Very much; 2= Pretty much; 3= Some; 4= Only a little; 5= Not at all

ElementDescription: When your child has been out one evening, does he/she want to tell you about what has happened??
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: Does your child tell you how he/she is doing in different classes at school?
Notes: 1= Almost always tells; 2= Tells rather a lot; 3= Partly; 4= Keeps a lot to herself, himself; 5= Keeps almost everything to herself, himself

ElementDescription: If the child has been out very late one night, do you then demand that the child carefully state what he/she has been up to and what friends were with him/her?
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: Does your child have your permission to be out late at night on a week night?
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: Does your child have to ask you before he/she can decide with friends what they are doing on a Friday/Saturday night?
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: Do you always demand to know where the child is in the evenings, who he/she meets and what your child is doing?
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: If your child goes out on a Friday/Saturday night, does he/she then have to inform you beforehand about where he/she is going and who he/she is going to meet.?
Notes: 1= Yes, always; 2= Yes, most of the time; 3= Yes, sometimes; 4= No, seldom; 5= No, never

ElementDescription: Total Score for Parental Monitoring
Notes: Sum(PMQ_1, PMQ_2, PMQ_3, PMQ_4, PMQ_5, PMQ_6, PMQ_7, PMQ_8, PMQ_9, PMQ_10, PMQ_11, PMQ_12, PMQ_13, PMQ_14, PMQ_15, PMQ_16r, PMQ_17r, PMQ_18, PMQ_19, PMQ_20, PMQ_21, PMQ_22, PMQ_23, PMQ_24).

Notes: 0=0 Days; 1=1 day; 2=2 days; 3=3 days; 4=4 days; 5=5 days; 6=6 days; 7=7 days

ElementDescription: How close do you feel to your mother or female caregiver?
Notes: 1=Not close at all; 2=Not very close; 3=Somewhat close; 4=Quite Close; 5=Extremely close; 99=Not applicable/does not apply

ElementDescription: How close do you feel to your father or male caregiver?

Notes: 1=Never; 2=Hardly Ever; 3=Sometimes; 4=Most of the time; 5=Always
